company_info.name: NZ Tours
company_info.description: Premium New Zealand travel agency specializing in personalized tour experiences across both North and South Islands.
company_info.working_hours: Monday - Friday: 9 AM - 6 PM (NZST), Saturday: 10 AM - 4 PM

faqs.question: What is the best time to visit New Zealand?
faqs.answer: The best time to visit New Zealand depends on your interests. Summer (December-February) offers warm weather perfect for beaches and hiking. Winter (June-August) is ideal for skiing in Queenstown and Wanaka. Spring (September-November) and Autumn (March-May) offer mild weather, fewer crowds, and beautiful scenery. We recommend booking 3-6 months in advance for peak season.

faqs.question: How do I book a tour package?
faqs.answer: You can book a tour package through our website by browsing available packages and clicking 'Inquire Now', or use our custom trip planner to create a personalized itinerary. Our team will contact you within 24-48 hours to confirm details and process your booking. A 20% deposit is required to secure your booking.

faqs.question: What is your cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Our cancellation policy offers full refund if cancelled 30+ days before departure (minus processing fee), 50% refund for 15-29 days before departure, and no refund for less than 15 days. We strongly recommend travel insurance. For COVID-related cancellations, we offer flexible rebooking options.

faqs.question: Do you offer private tours?
faqs.answer: Yes! We offer private tours for couples, families, and groups. Private tours can be customized to your preferences, schedule, and pace. They include a dedicated guide and vehicle. Contact us for a personalized quote - private tours typically cost 30-50% more than group tours.

faqs.question: What is included in tour packages?
faqs.answer: Our tour packages typically include: accommodation (3-5 star hotels/lodges), transportation (comfortable vehicles), guided activities and entry fees, some meals (breakfast always included), and 24/7 support. International flights, travel insurance, personal expenses, and optional activities are usually excluded. Check each package for specific inclusions.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to visit New Zealand?
faqs.answer: Visa requirements depend on your nationality. Citizens from 60+ countries (including USA, UK, EU, Australia) can visit visa-free for up to 90 days. You'll need a valid passport (6+ months validity) and may need to complete an NZeTA (Electronic Travel Authority). We recommend checking Immigration New Zealand's website for current requirements.

faqs.question: What currency is used in New Zealand?
faqs.answer: New Zealand uses the New Zealand Dollar (NZD). Credit cards are widely accepted, and ATMs are available in all towns. We recommend notifying your bank before traveling. Tipping is not expected but appreciated for exceptional service (10% is generous).

faqs.question: Is New Zealand safe for tourists?
faqs.answer: New Zealand is one of the safest countries in the world for tourists. Crime rates are low, people are friendly, and the healthcare system is excellent. However, respect nature - weather can change quickly, and some hiking trails are challenging. Always follow safety guidelines for outdoor activities.

faqs.question: What should I pack for New Zealand?
faqs.answer: Pack layers! New Zealand weather is changeable. Essentials include: comfortable walking shoes, rain jacket, sunscreen (UV is strong), sunglasses, swimwear, warm layers for evenings, and any prescription medications. For adventure activities, we provide necessary equipment.

faqs.question: Can you accommodate dietary requirements?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! New Zealand caters well to vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, and other dietary needs. Please inform us when booking so we can ensure all meals and restaurants accommodate your requirements. Halal and Kosher options are available in major cities.

destinations.name: Auckland
destinations.description: New Zealand's largest city, known as the 'City of Sails'. Gateway to beautiful beaches, volcanic islands, and world-class dining.

destinations.name: Rotorua
destinations.description: Geothermal wonderland and center of Maori culture. Famous for bubbling mud pools, geysers, and authentic cultural experiences.

destinations.name: Hobbiton
destinations.description: The magical movie set from Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit. A must-visit for any Tolkien fan.

destinations.name: Queenstown
destinations.description: Adventure capital of the world! Stunning alpine scenery meets adrenaline-pumping activities.

destinations.name: Milford Sound
destinations.description: Fiordland's crown jewel - a dramatic fjord with towering peaks, waterfalls, and diverse wildlife.

destinations.name: Kaikoura
destinations.description: Where mountains meet the sea. World-renowned for whale watching and fresh crayfish.

activities.name: Bungee Jumping
activities.description: Experience the world's first commercial bungee jump at Kawarau Bridge or the terrifying Nevis Bungy (134m).

activities.name: Whale Watching
activities.description: See giant sperm whales year-round, plus dolphins, seals, and albatross. 95% success rate for whale sightings.

activities.name: Hobbiton Movie Set Tour
activities.description: Walk through the Shire and visit 44 hobbit holes. Includes a drink at the Green Dragon Inn.

activities.name: Milford Sound Cruise
activities.description: Cruise through dramatic fjord scenery past waterfalls, rainforest, and wildlife.

activities.name: Glacier Hiking
activities.description: Walk on ancient glaciers with expert guides. Helicopter access to pristine ice formations.

activities.name: Maori Cultural Experience
activities.description: Traditional welcome, cultural performance, and hangi feast cooked in earth ovens.

policies.booking: 20% deposit required at booking, balance due 30 days before departure
policies.group_size: Small group tours: 8-16 people. Private tours available on request.
policies.age_requirements: Most tours suitable for all ages. Adventure activities may have age/health restrictions.
policies.insurance: Travel insurance strongly recommended and required for adventure activities
policies.guides: All guides are licensed, local experts with first aid certification

summer.tips: Book accommodation early. Great for beaches, hiking, and festivals. Peak tourist season.

autumn.tips: Fewer crowds, great photography opportunities. Wine harvest season.

winter.tips: Perfect for skiing. Lower prices on North Island. Whale watching peak.

spring.tips: Lambing season, gardens blooming. Great for wildlife and fewer tourists.
